required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on April 13, 2016
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Omarigliptin (MK-3102) Clinical Trial - Placebo- and Sitagliptin-Controlled Monotherapy Study in Japanese Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus (MK-3102-020)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase III, Multicenter, Randomized, Placebo- and Sitagliptin-controlled, Parallel-group, Double-blinded Study and Subsequent Open-label, Extension Study to Assess the Safety and Efficacy of MK-3102 in Japanese Patients With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitis Who Have Inadequate Glycemic Control on Diet/Exercise Therapy

oversight_info.authority: Japan: Pharmaceuticals and Medical Devices Agency

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess the efficacy of omarigliptin 25 mg weekly (as monotherapy) compared with sitagliptin 50 mg daily and placebo, and the long term safety (up to 52 weeks) of omarigliptin 25 mg weekly. The primary hypotheses are that after 24 weeks: 1) Omarigliptin 25 mg weekly provides a greater reduction from baseline in glycosylated hemoglobin (HbA1c) compared with placebo, and 2) The mean change from baseline in HbA1c in participants treated with omarigliptin 25 mg weekly is non-inferior compared with that in participants treated with sitagliptin 50 mg daily.

detailed_description.textblock: The treatment period is composed of a 24-week double-blind period (Phase A) and a 28-week open-label period (Phase B). Participants will receive in Phase A: omarigliptin 25 mg once weekly, sitagliptin 50 mg once daily or placebo and in Phase B: omarigliptin 25 mg once weekly.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline for Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) at Week 24
primary_outcome.description: HbA1C is blood marker used to report average blood glucose levels over a prolonged periods of time and is reported as a percentage (%). Change in A1C following 24 weeks of therapy (i.e., A1C at Week 24 minus A1C at baseline).

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Experienced at Least One Adverse Event During Phase A
primary_outcome.description: An adverse event (AE) is defined as any unfavorable and unintended sign including an abnormal laboratory finding, symptom or disease associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, regardless of whether it is considered related to the medical treatment or procedure, that occurs during the course of the study.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Experienced at Least One Adverse Event During the Overall Study
primary_outcome.description: An AE is defined as any unfavorable and unintended sign including an abnormal laboratory finding, symptom or disease associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, regardless of whether it is considered related to the medical treatment or procedure, that occurs during the course of the study. These results represent the accrual of events over different treatment intervals: 52 weeks, omarigliptin (Phase A+B) defined as the double-blind period and open label extension period versus 28 weeks for the Sitagliptin (Phase A) → Omarigliptin (Phase B) and placebo (Phase A) → Omarigliptin (Phase B) group defined as the open-label extension period only.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Discontinued From the Study Due to an Adverse Event During Phase A
primary_outcome.description: An AE is defined as any unfavorable and unintended sign including an abnormal laboratory finding, symptom or disease associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, regardless of whether it is considered related to the medical treatment or procedure, that occurs during the course of the study.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Who Discontinued From the Study Due to an Adverse Event During the Overall Study
primary_outcome.description: An AE is defined as any unfavorable and unintended sign including an abnormal laboratory finding, symptom or disease associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, regardless of whether it is considered related to the medical treatment or procedure, that occurs during the course of the study. These results represent the accrual of events over different treatment intervals: 52 weeks, omarigliptin (Phase A+B) defined as the double-blind period and open label extension period versus 28 weeks for the Sitagliptin (Phase A) → Omarigliptin (Phase B) and placebo (Phase A) → Omarigliptin (Phase B) group defined as the open-label extension period only.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline for 2-hour Post Meal Glucose (PMG) at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline at Week 24 is defined as PMG at Week 24 minus PMG at Week 0.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline for Fasting Plasma Glucose (FPG) at Week 24
secondary_outcome.description: Blood glucose was measured on a fasting basis. FPG is expressed as mg/dL. Blood was drawn at predose on Day 1 and after 24 weeks of treatment to determine change in plasma glucose levels (i.e., FPG at Week 24 minus FPG at baseline).

arm_group.description: Omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly and matching placebo to sitagliptin administered orally once daily for 24 weeks (Phase A), followed by omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 28 weeks (Phase B).

Sitagliptin 50 mg administered orally once daily and matching placebo to omarigliptin administered orally once weekly for 24 weeks (Phase A), followed by omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 28 weeks (Phase B).

Matching placebo to omarigliptin administered orally once weekly and matching placebo to sitagliptin administered orally once daily for 24 weeks (Phase A), followed by omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 28 weeks (Phase B).

intervention.description: Omarigliptin (MK-3102) 25 mg capsule administered orally once weekly
Sitagliptin 50 mg tablet administered orally once daily
Matching placebo to omarigliptin 25 mg capsule administered orally once weekly
Matching placebo to sitagliptin 50 mg tablet administered orally once daily

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Has type 2 diabetes mellitus
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of type 1 diabetes mellitus or a history of ketoacidosis
- History of any of the following medications: thiazolidinediones and/or insulin within 12 weeks prior to study participation, omarigliptin and/or sitagliptin anytime

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Forty-eight sites in Japan received IRB approval and were shipped clinical supplies in this study and randomized at least one participant. One hundred and seventeen participants were not randomized; the most common reason for particpants not being randomized was screen failure.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: In Phase A, participants were randomized to receive either omarigliptin 25 mg once weekly, sitagliptin 50 mg once daily or placebo for 24 weeks in a blinded manner. In Phase B, all participants received open-label omarigliptin 25 mg once weekly for 28 weeks.

group.title: Omarigliptin (Phase A+B)
group.description: Omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly and matching placebo to sitagliptin administered orally once daily for 24 weeks (Phase A), followed by omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 28 weeks (Phase B).

group.title: Sitagliptin (Phase A) → Omarigliptin (Phase B)
group.description: Sitagliptin 50 mg administered orally once daily and matching placebo to omarigliptin administered orally once weekly for 24 weeks (Phase A), followed by omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 28 weeks (Phase B).

group.title: Placebo (Phase A) → Omarigliptin (Phase B)
group.description: Matching placebo to omarigliptin administered orally once weekly and matching placebo to sitagliptin administered orally once daily for 24 weeks (Phase A), followed by omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 28 weeks (Phase B).

group.title: Omarigliptin (Phase A+B)
group.description: Omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly and matching placebo to sitagliptin administered orally once daily for 24 weeks (Phase A), followed by omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 28 weeks (Phase B).

group.title: Sitagliptin (Phase A) → Omarigliptin (Phase B)
group.description: Sitagliptin 50 mg administered orally once daily and matching placebo to omarigliptin administered orally once weekly for 24 weeks (Phase A), followed by omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 28 weeks (Phase B).

group.title: Placebo (Phase A) → Omarigliptin (Phase B)
group.description: Matching placebo to omarigliptin administered orally once weekly and matching placebo to sitagliptin administered orally once daily for 24 weeks (Phase A), followed by omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 28 weeks (Phase B).

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Change From Baseline for Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) at Week 24
outcome.description: HbA1C is blood marker used to report average blood glucose levels over a prolonged periods of time and is reported as a percentage (%). Change in A1C following 24 weeks of therapy (i.e., A1C at Week 24 minus A1C at baseline).
outcome.population: The Full Analysis Set (FAS) consisted of all randomized participants who had at least one study drug and had a baseline or post-randomization measurement for this outcome measure.

group.title: Omarigliptin (Phase A+B)
group.description: Omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly and matching placebo to sitagliptin administered orally once daily for 24 weeks (Phase A), followed by omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 28 weeks (Phase B).

group.title: Sitagliptin (Phase A) → Omarigliptin (Phase B)
group.description: Sitagliptin 50 mg administered orally once daily and matching placebo to omarigliptin administered orally once weekly for 24 weeks (Phase A), followed by omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 28 weeks (Phase B).

group.title: Placebo (Phase A) → Omarigliptin (Phase B)
group.description: Matching placebo to omarigliptin administered orally once weekly and matching placebo to sitagliptin administered orally once daily for 24 weeks (Phase A), followed by omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 28 weeks (Phase B).

measure.title: Change From Baseline for Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) at Week 24
measure.description: HbA1C is blood marker used to report average blood glucose levels over a prolonged periods of time and is reported as a percentage (%). Change in A1C following 24 weeks of therapy (i.e., A1C at Week 24 minus A1C at baseline).

analysis.method_desc: Terms for treatment, prior oral antihyperglycemic agent (AHA), time, time by: treatment, prior AHA therapy status, and treatment by prior AHA status.
analysis.param_type: Difference in the least squares means

analysis.method_desc: Terms for treatment, prior AHA therapy status (yes/no), time, and time by: treatment, prior AHA therapy status, and treatment by prior AHA status.
analysis.param_type: Difference in the least squares means

analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Omarigliptin will be considered non-inferior to sitagliptin if the upper bound of the two-sided 95% confidence interval of the between-treatment difference in least squares means for change from baseline in HbA1c at Week 24 (omarigliptin minus sitagliptin) is not more than 0.3% (non-inferiority margin).
analysis.method_desc: Terms for treatment, prior AHA therapy status (yes/no), time, and time by: treatment, prior AHA therapy status, and treatment by prior AHA status.
analysis.param_type: Difference in the least squares means

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Who Experienced at Least One Adverse Event During Phase A
outcome.description: An adverse event (AE) is defined as any unfavorable and unintended sign including an abnormal laboratory finding, symptom or disease associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, regardless of whether it is considered related to the medical treatment or procedure, that occurs during the course of the study.
outcome.population: All Subjects as Treated (ASaT) population consisted of all randomized participants who received at least one study drug.

measure.description: An adverse event (AE) is defined as any unfavorable and unintended sign including an abnormal laboratory finding, symptom or disease associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, regardless of whether it is considered related to the medical treatment or procedure, that occurs during the course of the study.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Who Experienced at Least One Adverse Event During the Overall Study
outcome.description: An AE is defined as any unfavorable and unintended sign including an abnormal laboratory finding, symptom or disease associated with the use of a medical treatment or procedure, regardless of whether it is considered related to the medical treatment or procedure, that occurs during the course of the study. These results represent the accrual of events over different treatment intervals: 52 weeks, omarigliptin (Phase A+B) defined as the double-blind period and open label extension period versus 28 weeks for the Sitagliptin (Phase A) → Omarigliptin (Phase B) and placebo (Phase A) → Omarigliptin (Phase B) group defined as the open-label extension period only.
outcome.population: The ASaT Population included all randomized participants who received at least one study drug. Data was unavailable for 7 participants who discontinued the study in sitagliptin and placebo arms in Phase A.

reported_events.time_frame: Up to 52 weeks (For the Omarigliptin (Phase A+B) arms, AEs occurring during the 52 weeks of omarigliptin administration were presented. For the sitagliptin and placebo arms, AEs occurring during 28 weeks of omar. administration (Phase B) were presented.
reported_events.desc: The ASaT Population was used for this analysis and included all randomized participants who received at least one study drug. 7 participants in the sitagliptin and placebo arms discontinued the study in Phase A.

group.title: Omarigliptin (Phase A+B)
group.description: Omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly and matching placebo to sitagliptin administered orally once daily for 24 weeks (Phase A), followed by omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 28 weeks (Phase B).

group.title: Sitagliptin (Phase A) → Omarigliptin (Phase B)
group.description: Sitagliptin 50 mg administered orally once daily and matching placebo to omarigliptin administered orally once weekly for 24 weeks (Phase A), followed by omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 28 weeks (Phase B).

group.description: Matching placebo to omarigliptin administered orally once weekly and matching placebo to sitagliptin administered orally once daily for 24 weeks (Phase A), followed by omarigliptin 25 mg administered orally once weekly for 28 weeks (Phase B).

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The sponsor must have the opportunity to review all proposed abstracts, manuscripts or presentations regarding this trial 45 days prior to submission for publication/presentation. Any information identified by the sponsor as confidential must be deleted prior to submission; this confidentiality does not include efficacy and safety results.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
